intro: Thesium albomontanum, commonly known as the white mountain thesium, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its compact, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom during the cooler months. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often covered in a fine layer of white wax, giving it a distinctive appearance. Thesium albomontanum is adapted to rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in montane grasslands.
